ae687b36-a024-41c4-aef6-83ab082bdf6c: A dragon is a reptilelike creature, usually winged, with magical or unusual abilities.
269dbc5e-bc82-4710-b71d-9d6262572d87: After walking the roads of the Abyss, the Commander returns to {mf|his|her} home plane. Waiting for {mf|him|her} here is not only Drezen, but also a magical rock raised above the ground by unknown forces, and a motley assembly of {mf|his|her} followers, who call themselves free crusaders. The time is coming when the Commander's power will change from a gentle gust of wind to something quite different. Will it become a destructive tempest? Perhaps a life-giving spring breeze? Or something else?
bb514e9a-11e2-4b49-a37f-edc8b83091a6: An azata cannot be too evil, or too lawful, in their actions. If the Commander follows {mf|his|her} heart when making choices, {mf|he|she} can change who {mf|he|she} is, and make {mf|his|her} little dragon friend happy.
62c660b2-0f8a-4583-81ed-b17aee62630d: An enemy has to pass a {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Reflex saving throw{/g} or be ensnared in tree roots. While in this state, the enemy cannot move, and has a 50% miss chance on all {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attacks{/g}, as if all their opponents had total {g|Encyclopedia:Concealment}concealment{/g}. Each {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g} enemy tries to pass another Reflex saving throw to break free. If the save fails, the enemy suffers ({g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d6{/g} + half the Azata's {g|Encyclopedia:Caster_Level}caster level{/g}) {g|Encyclopedia:Damage_Type}bludgeoning damage{/g}.
bbfae127-4158-4541-a2e6-9e8f62eb85b6: At 3rd rank, Azata gets a Dragon as an animal companion. Unlike normal animals of its kind, an animal companion's {g|Encyclopedia:Hit_Dice}Hit Dice{/g}, abilities, {g|Encyclopedia:Skills}skills{/g}, and {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}feats{/g} advance as the Azata gains mythic ranks.
838132be-d424-4bd5-9682-3a7944f082fe: Azata can choose from her superpowers to enhance herself.
c481b45c-834f-4035-885d-d7b16ece8698: Azata can decide to lose the advantages of Incredible Might to instead bolster the physical abilities of companions. They gain a {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on all {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g} and {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage rolls{/g} equal to +1 per 2 Azata's mythic ranks.
b57c0c5a-c278-4dd9-a6e1-aa8721872b25: Azata can grant one companion immunity to prone condition and immunity to {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Maneuvers}combat maneuvers{/g} for one {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g} per {g|Encyclopedia:Caster_Level}caster level{/g}. If the affected companion was critically hit, they are also affected with the effect of the blink effect for one round per 4 Azata's caster levels.
d91f67ec-f2c3-4636-afaf-8f64f1a832e9: Azata channels positive energy that cures all allies in a 30-foot area for ({g|Encyclopedia:Dice}2d8{/g} +1 per {g|Encyclopedia:Caster_Level}caster level{/g}) points of {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g}, and grants them randomly an effect from one of her following {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spells{/g}: Rejuvenating Poem, Optimistic Smile or Believe in Yourself
615142f8-387c-45c7-8243-54ecc72171a8: Azata chooses one teamwork {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}feat{/g} during this and next mythic rank up. She shares the effects of all teamwork feats she has with allies within a 50-foot area. Azata's {g|Encyclopedia:Charisma}Charisma{/g} inspires her allies so much that even when their {g|Encyclopedia:HP}hit points{/g} drop below 0 they continue to fight, even though they are still considered dead (or {g|Encyclopedia:Injury_Death}unconscious{/g}) for all effects and can be cured by breath of life or similar {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spells{/g} as per spell description. After the encounter or upon receiving a total number of {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attacks{/g} equal to Azata's Charisma ability modifier shared among all allies, the allies in this state fall dead (or unconscious). If all of the Azata's allies die that way, she becomes fully drained and dies.
10d63211-518d-4751-893f-fca4febf2e76: Azata covers herself in flowers with tiny bees. She gets {g|Encyclopedia:Damage_Reduction}DR{/g} 5/Adamantine. Any creature that makes a successful {g|Encyclopedia:MeleeAttack}melee attack{/g} against Azata takes ({g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d6{/g} + her {g|Encyclopedia:Caster_Level}caster level{/g}) points of {g|Encyclopedia:Damage_Type}piercing damage{/g}.
fc867034-7128-4796-b267-70ccf788b084: Azata creates a 15-foot cone of wind dealing ({g|Encyclopedia:Dice}3d6{/g} + her {g|Encyclopedia:Caster_Level}caster level{/g}) sonic {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} to all enemies inside it. Every affected enemy has to pass a {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Fortitude saving throw{/g} or become disoriented and unable to cast any {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spells{/g} for 1d3 {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}rounds{/g}.
003e0019-7cf9-43fd-af02-9e844beee5bd: Azata creates a 30-foot area of blossoming flowers. They entangle and calm enemies, enemies have to pass a {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Reflex saving throw{/g}. They try to pass a saving throw each {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g} while they are within the affected area. If the enemy failed the saving throw the first time, they are distracted by flowers. Distracted enemies receive a -2 {g|Encyclopedia:Penalty}penalty{/g} to {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g} and {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g}. If the enemy failed the saving throw the second time, the enemy become staggered. If the enemy failed the saving throw the third time, the enemy falls asleep for {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d4{/g} rounds. After the enemy awakes from sleep, he is immune to being staggered or fall asleep from this {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} but still suffers the penalties.
8e27f81e-2513-46e3-8f5f-e920dc420337: Azata creates a 30-foot cone of leaves that deals {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d10{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Damage_Type}slashing damage{/g} per 2 caster levels to all creatures within the cone. A creature who suffers {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} from this {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} has to pass a {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Will saving throw{/g} or become intoxicated for 1 {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g} per {g|Encyclopedia:Caster_Level}caster level{/g}. Whenever the creature under this effect makes a roll, it rolls twice and chooses the worst result. A successful saving throw reduces the duration of this effect to 1 round.
17e2bc10-c085-46ba-824a-1cfa937c4be9: Azata creates a 30-foot cone of water dealing {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d6{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} per 4 {g|Encyclopedia:Caster_Level}caster levels{/g}. Affected enemy has to pass a {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Fortitude saving throw{/g} or be pushed away 10 feet away and then knocked down. If the affected creature passes its saving throw, it is only pushed away for 5 feet and becomes slowed down for 1 {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g}.
00078192-9808-4b0e-9a15-3f7b488744da: Azata creates a rainbow arrow that jumps from target to target up to one time per 4 {g|Encyclopedia:Caster_Level}caster levels{/g}, dealing {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d12{/g} per 2 caster levels {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} with one energy randomly chosen between acid, cold, electricity, fire, or sound.
29af869a-727b-488e-b3f4-0bbac2482ecf: Azata creates a waterfall, the affected creature suffers a {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d10{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Damage_Type}bludgeoning damage{/g} per 4 Azata's caster levels and has to pass a {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Fortitude saving throw{/g} or be knocked down for 1 {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g} and become vulnerable to cold for 1 minute per Azata's {g|Encyclopedia:Caster_Level}caster level{/g}.
9cb6d44d-7b82-4653-aede-5504b9e44dd4: Azata creates bolts that deal {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d6{/g} sonic {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} per 2 caster levels to all adjacent creatures and half her {g|Encyclopedia:Caster_Level}caster level{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Damage}sonic damage{/g} to all creatures in a 10-foot area.
637776ea-3b33-494e-9a7b-4a387e662411: Azata creates nauseating plants in a 40-foot area for 1 {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g} per {g|Encyclopedia:Caster_Level}caster level{/g}. Any creature within this area has to pass a {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Fortitude saving throw{/g} or become nauseated and suffer {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}2d6{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Damage}acid damage{/g} every round. Every round creature tries to stop being nauseated by making further Fortitude saving throws. A successful save makes the creature immune to this effect until the end of the combat.
3c45c29a-139c-4dbf-8cc1-6b437a17d9ad: Azata envelops her and her companions in a shroud of swirling leaves. Under this effect, all {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attacks{/g} against Azata and her companions suffer a 50% miss chance. You become immune to {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Damage}cold damage{/g}, whenever an enemy casts a {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} against you, they suffer {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d6{/g} sonic {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} per 5 Azata's {g|Encyclopedia:Caster_Level}caster levels{/g}.
a2b3079c-e7b7-4af6-8937-8c3846aa3583:
Azata gains a morale {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} equal to her mythic rank on {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g} and {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage rolls{/g}. Whenever she hits with a charge attack or confirms a {g|Encyclopedia:Critical}critical hit{/g}, the target has to pass a {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Fortitude saving throw{/g}, with {g|Encyclopedia:DC}DC{/g} equal to 10 + your mythic rank + {g|Encyclopedia:Strength}Strength{/g} modifier. If the target fails a saving throw one of the following {g|Encyclopedia:CA_Types}action{/g} happens at random:
Enemy is stunned for {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d4{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}rounds{/g} (30%)
Enemy is prone for 1d4 rounds (20%)
Enemy is pushed away 15 feet and is stunned for 1d4 rounds (20%)
Enemy is crippled till the end of the fight: they can no longer move and suffers a -3 {g|Encyclopedia:Penalty}penalty{/g} to attack rolls and {g|Encyclopedia:Armor_Class}AC{/g} (15%)
Enemy becomes exhausted (10%)
Enemy is killed (5%)
Additionally, Azata can decide to lose these advantages to instead bolster the physical abilities of companions. They gain a bonus on all attack and damage rolls equal to +1 per 2 Azata's mythic ranks.
7e3b0469-292e-40f5-a7a4-fe27dde88aff: Azata gains a {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} equal to her mythic rank to all {g|Encyclopedia:Skills}skill checks{/g}. Whenever she makes a skill {g|Encyclopedia:Check}check{/g}, she {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}rolls{/g} the die twice, and chooses the best result. She also becomes proficient with all types of weapons and armor.
21f03fc8-d945-423b-b3f9-349ce59f2b8e: Azata gains fast {g|Encyclopedia:Healing}healing{/g} equal to half her mythic rank. From 4th mythic rank on, this number is increased by +5 per mythic rank. Whenever an enemy confirms a {g|Encyclopedia:Critical}critical hit{/g} against Azata, her inner endurance is unleashed: she gets {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d6{/g} temporary {g|Encyclopedia:HP}hit points{/g} per mythic rank, and if she has 25% or less hit points left, she gains {g|Encyclopedia:Damage_Reduction}DR{/g} 10/—.
9e473bfa-e530-465a-8b5f-866176e99553: Azata inspires party members. This {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} grants party members a +4 morale {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on {g|Encyclopedia:Check}checks{/g} to overcome {g|Encyclopedia:Spell_Resistance}spell resistance{/g}, and increase the {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saving throw{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:DC}DC{/g} of their spells that require a Will saving throw by 2.
2cc25466-fefc-471a-8b99-b9760ce2af10: Azata invokes voices of a renewal. This {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damages{/g} all enemies within a 30-foot area for ({g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d6{/g} + 1 per {g|Encyclopedia:Caster_Level}caster level{/g}) {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Damage}sonic damage{/g}, while channeling positive energy that cures allies for (1d6 +1 per caster level) points of damage.
29dd7db5-4c58-477b-8313-57654d40cfa2:
Azata is always under the effect of haste {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g}, as long as she is engaged in combat. All melee and ranged weapon {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attacks{/g} against her have a 20% miss chance. All targeted {g|Encyclopedia:Spell_Target}spells aimed{/g} at her have a 10% miss chance. All the {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} from area attacks against her is halved, even if previously reduced by saving throw.
Note: When character have miss chance and concealment at the same time, then only best bonus applied.
5fad6b83-655a-4c59-a440-86ebe90d01b3: Azata shouts out, dealing ({g|Encyclopedia:Dice}4d6{/g} + her {g|Encyclopedia:Caster_Level}caster level{/g}) sonic {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} to all creatures within a 30-foot range. This shout encourages a revolt within the enemy ranks. All affected enemies have to pass a {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Will saving throw{/g} or start to {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g} the strongest among them. Each {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g} they try to pass a new Will save to end the effect. If an enemy successfully saves and ends the Revolt effect, they suffer 4d6 + Azata's casting level {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Damage}sonic damage{/g} each round for 1d6 rounds as inner voices shout within making them regret what they had done.
ed14dd4a-4d58-4fb6-a5a0-08ea967bfef6: Azata starts a performance that grants a chosen companion {g|Encyclopedia:Damage_Reduction}DR{/g} 5/- and immunity to fear effects. All enemies in the 50-foot range from the Azata must pass a {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Will saving throw{/g} or be forced to {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g} a chosen companion. Base DC to this saving throw is equal 10 + half your character level + your mythic rank + your highest ability modifier.
228cc8d9-2935-404d-b762-178a4d2111f5: Azata starts a performance that grants all allies within 50 feet a freedom of movement effect and immunity to compulsion {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spells{/g} and {g|Encyclopedia:Special_Abilities}spell-like abilities{/g}.
52deb998-d8df-41d9-b70d-6685d78e7556: Azata starts a performance that grants all allies within 50 feet a luck {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on all {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saving throws{/g} equal to half her mythic rank. Whenever an ally under this effect makes a successful saving throw, that ally is {g|Encyclopedia:Healing}healed{/g} for a number of {g|Encyclopedia:HP}hit points{/g} equal to {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}2d6{/g} + Azata's mythic rank.
841cf1f1-1dc0-49db-b832-d7bb1725367f: Azata starts a performance that grants all allies within 50 feet {g|Encyclopedia:Damage_Reduction}DR{/g} 5/lawful and {g|Encyclopedia:Regeneration}Regeneration{/g} 5 (lawful).
6c36ec23-552b-4219-b791-07603886bb62: Azata summons a wave of water. It deals {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}6d6{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Damage_Type}bludgeoning damage{/g} to all enemies in the area. Every affected enemy has to pass a {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Fortitude saving throw{/g} or be knocked down, slowed down and become vulnerable to bludgeoning {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} for 1d6 {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}rounds{/g}. All allies affected by this wave are cleansed from all of the following conditions: {g|Encyclopedia:AbilityDamage}ability damage{/g}, blinded, confused, dazzled, diseased, exhausted, fatigued, nauseated, poisoned, and sickened.
4a107d57-9482-446f-a15e-6e8de3d2d65c: Azata summons the power of Life itself. Azata and her companions' {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attacks{/g} deal holy damage for 1 {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g} per 2 {g|Encyclopedia:Caster_Level}caster levels{/g}. This {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} restores all companions spell slots up to 5th level, however it doesn't affect Azata's Mythic Spell book.
84eb8969-0027-4268-968b-2b7420b09879: Azata uses this {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} to restore all companions' ability uses to the maximum amount.
b8442967-63e3-4bdd-8ff6-95d43db11ca1: Azata's dragon emits an aura of heroism. While she is alive, all allies are under a constant effect of the heroism {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g}.
138db54a-0f35-4077-a852-6ea91fc11102: Azata's dragon's breath weapons don't affect allies.
37ca413a-5ef4-40fe-989c-6927d946c1c6: Azata's magic becomes incredibly more powerful. Whenever an enemy makes a {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saving throw{/g} against her {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spells{/g}, they {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}roll{/g} the die twice and take the worst result. Whenever the Azata makes a {g|Encyclopedia:Concentration}concentration check{/g} or a {g|Encyclopedia:Check}check{/g} to overcome {g|Encyclopedia:Spell_Resistance}spell resistance{/g}, she rolls twice and takes the best result. If the Azata casts a spell whose description says that a successful saving throw halves its {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} or duration, it only decreases it by 25% instead.
24dce419-8170-414a-8e47-88bf9b14959d: Azata's smile encourages optimism. This {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} removes all fear, confusion, compulsion, shaken, and frightened effect from party members and grants an immunity to fear till the end of combat.
0049d9f7-50ac-40f0-8d8b-b38f5c2c867a: Breath Weapon — Ability is not ready yet
d7173851-8d45-4201-bfb8-c1916c80db64: Change alignment, then talk to Aivu
7a54c543-2792-4b34-bd4d-605c343de307: Eager to create something extraordinary, the three Desnan adepts have devised an unusual ritual. Its intended purpose is to trace the Commander's secret longings and teleport {mf|him|her} to the place {mf|his|her} soul calls for, quite literally. Ilkes, Aranka, and Wallflower are waiting for the Commander's signal to begin the ritual.
2b60a431-9ad3-4a0e-8151-ef2aed8a77e9: Early Sunset is preparing to question slavers while disguised as a powerful demon and potential buyer. If Aivu is still in Alushinyrra, the slavers will rush to procure a dragon for an influential client. The Commander has been tasked with secretly providing protection, and needs to escort {mf|his|her} comrade to the Fleshmarkets.
23141cc3-8d9b-4467-96a5-f6dba4a2a944: Find out what is happening on the island
c022474c-f528-4063-bd7e-c3375bc19c0b: Follow the call of the soul
945dd7f4-4edf-4209-be6c-1e890cc5596a: It is done, and it has changed the face of Alushinyrra, perhaps forever.
fe22c84a-87cb-48b7-ae43-8ff038a065c1: It was not so difficult to follow Aivu's advice, and fully embrace the Path of Elysium.
adce1f84-2ab4-45e8-9758-a7c38dcae063: Maestro Aven'Turine needs thirty mosaic pieces, which can be obtained by transforming items on the ridge.
b6d6508c-c640-4a1a-a139-d4c68286ff6e: Maitresse Olla Devara, the alchemist, is eager to see the Commander at the Court on the ridge. Rumor has it that she's busy working on a new experiment.
7edcb2f2-a2ca-4b5d-95aa-83e708346893: Much like migratory birds that sense the change in the seasons, all kinds of dreamy and rebellious spirits sensed a new power emerge in the lands of the Worldwound. All of them are inspired by the Commander, the living embodiment of the so-called "wind of change." Will they come bearing good or evil? And where will this path lead them?
7a327913-0f21-4bba-91d0-7a1f95415520: Much of Early Sunset's behavior has been questionable. It is time to get some answers from him.
45de6634-80df-4d03-a6ae-9672e9956a4f: Once every {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d4{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}rounds{/g}, havoc dragon deals 2d10 points of sonic damage to everyone in a in 30-foot cone. This damage increases by 2d10 for every Azata mythic rank.
18c993fd-d77e-47b6-a2b9-9e27e765d5e4: Return to the Court and talk to Ilkes, Wallflower, and Aranka
899e442c-ecd6-449e-a624-7a3f83700a73: Since its transformation into a flourishing garden, the ridge has become home to the Commander's followers, those who style themselves as "free crusaders." They are now settling in and they expect their host to drop by in two weeks.
15e812a7-8397-40d0-8e72-28922e228492: Song of Courageous Defender — Choose Companion
eff530ca-9f68-4fde-83ff-d5cbe252e386: Summon Azata Ghaels and Astral Devas
f2f8da49-135f-4848-b22f-cadbef87669e: Summon Early Sunset for a conversation
ad82a832-5b30-41b7-be9b-bd0dacab0511: Talk to the artist and the sculptors
cf848433-6088-4b1d-b52c-ed4b96ee28d1: The Commander's longtime associate has arrived in the Abyss and has a suggestion for how to find Aivu. He is waiting in the Nexus, at the former rift known as the Gates of Midnight.
1ef4ed8e-3e54-4bb5-a2a8-a8860924b86d: The Fleshmarkets and its operations have severely tested the Commander's patience. Now that Aivu has been returned, it's time to go there and show these evildoers how wrong they are.
0153fb24-5764-4623-9d5b-a7b59120ce21: The artists of the Court want to use items transformed by the ridge to create a unique work of art.
8248aa6b-12d3-407a-a5bd-b7f44e1225b2: The bard is having an argument with her friend, the priest. Perhaps the Commander can help them come to a decision.
f63a7139-fc54-44d5-ad12-004e0ba43bc1: The call of the soul turned out to be either a mistake or a trap... Or could this truly be the place the Commander's soul was yearning for?
9b36c48d-238e-4836-9e4d-5c427db4af93: The call of {mf|his|her} soul brought the Commander to a place the Desnan adepts never expected. How will they react to their ritual yielding such unforeseen results?
5c071b92-639d-49a3-8c5d-7a547f0bc1b4: The calm before the storm — never has that phrase been more apt. Every one of the Commander's followers is certain that something extraordinary is about to happen, but what, and when?
5117723d-946e-4e76-8b27-a914e9a6682e: The cavalry sculptors need thirty edible things transformed by burying them on the ridge.
68358a9f-b3cb-4c9e-803d-5c3dd59b51ad: The destination of the ritual... doesn't look quite as expected. The Commander must explore this strange place to understand what has happened.
e0823ca4-d331-4c2e-b202-544f8eac91c6: The location where the dragon is being held has been discovered. It is in the Middle City, not far from the Fleshmarkets. It will be necessary to go to Shed-Skin's hideout and either rescue Aivu by force, or make a deal with the marilith.
28175594-dafd-49c5-853b-14494e485b22: The magic island set off after its creator on a journey through the Worldwound. And it seems some calamity has befallen it. It's time to act.
a500190a-853d-49b1-971f-f441a2d53ceb: The most wondrous music comes from the soul, and the most powerful magic comes from the heart. At least that's what the Commander's followers claim. They want to awaken {mf|his|her} spiritual power and teleport {mf|him|her} to the place {mf|his|her} power yearns for. Where might that be? The breathtaking vistas of Elysium? The floating halls of the goddess Desna? The only way to find out is to rush bravely into the unknown.
dc1acd4b-b733-4d6b-8bc5-41f90d7a3807: The one who called himself Early Sunset is no longer standing in the Commander's way
c9d4b0ca-91ae-432b-9315-a1f42c78ee41: The power that has awakened within the Commander's soul is having a peculiar effect on {mf|him|her}. It seems to be making {mf|him|her} more and more like an azata, a whimsical creature from the plane of Elysium. But to follow this path to its end, to become the genuine embodiment of freedom and kindness, this new power is not enough. It cannot change the Commander. The Commander must do that {mf|himself|herself}.
aaa7f07d-4c67-41db-99fe-73ae5b745f1f: The strange power that dwells within the Commander has transformed an ordinary ridge into a wonderful floating island. This happened in no small part thanks to the free crusaders, who have created something truly special on the base given to them by the Commander.
232d4a5a-7183-4178-a01c-a238bebd5ed2: The street artist Aven'Turine and the reckless cavalry sculptors wish to speak to the Commander. They are abuzz with excitement over the ridge-turned-garden's newly discovered ability to transform buried items.
33391a34-bd87-4760-9b9e-881161ba66a4: The time has come for you to visit the Court.
f0201aae-21f5-40a5-9894-d2a928925da0: There are some questions that still need to be answered. What happened to the free crusaders while the Commander was away? Where has the one who called himself Early Sunset gone to? Perhaps, the answers can be found on the magic island.
f284a987-2fd5-4960-8d37-f657ae986e5a: There is one thing the Abyss can do very, very well — steal that which is most precious. This is what has happened to the Commander. Aivu, the Commander's beloved pet and focus of {mf|his|her} power, has been abducted. Finding and rescuing her in this strange, cruel plane seems impossible. But perhaps there is a way to make the impossible possible.
92952c25-e2a8-4a36-a31d-b09ff461eac1: Things are unsettled at the ridge-turned-garden — quite literally. What's going on?
ee7625bf-7566-41e7-8a19-079cfc6566d1: This ability summons a Azata Bralani for 1 minute. Summoned monsters appear where you designate and act according to their {g|Encyclopedia:Initiative}initiative{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Check}check{/g} results. Summoned monsters appear where you designate and act according to their {g|Encyclopedia:Initiative}initiative{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Check}check{/g} results. 0dbbf1dc-f468-4e36-bb6f-2bb9115199c3: This breath weapon deals {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d10{/g} points of sonic {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} per mythic rank in 30-foot cone. Those caught in the area of the breath receive a {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Reflex save{/g} for half damage. The {g|Encyclopedia:DC}DC{/g} of this save is equal to 10 + half HD + {g|Encyclopedia:Constitution}Con{/g} modifier.
a8fab450-75ab-4f87-b634-d24630ecb656: This creature is slowed and vulnerable to bludgeoning damage.
7a219b76-1d37-45d7-99a8-41e9e1d69854: This creature may call down lightning bolts.
81b651db-ebbb-4c89-b8c2-4e2c53af7b62: This {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} affects all companions. It removes fatigue, exhaustion, all negative levels, restores all abilities and spell slots up to level 7. This spell doesn't affect Azata's Mythic Spellbook.
1169c08e-7704-4174-b328-cfe5bbd58fdf: This {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} functions like call lightning storm, except Azata invokes a rainbow starfall. Every star deals {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d6{/g} per 3 {g|Encyclopedia:Caster_Level}caster levels{/g} points of acid, cold, electricity, fire, or sonic {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g}, depending on the greatest potential damage (taking into consideration the target's immunities and {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Resistance}energy resistances{/g}). You may call a maximum of 15 stars.
d797ad46-e935-4bef-a14d-d5deabceae2a: This {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} grants the target a +1 morale {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to chosen ability for each 4 {g|Encyclopedia:Caster_Level}caster levels{/g}.
387a4718-60e9-4ce2-bda3-aca1e3ccbea9: This {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} grants the target additional ({g|Encyclopedia:Dice}2d6{/g} + Azata's {g|Encyclopedia:Caster_Level}caster level{/g}) sonic {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} for their first weapon {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g} during a {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g}, a +2 {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to caster level {g|Encyclopedia:Check}checks{/g} made to overcome {g|Encyclopedia:Spell_Resistance}spell resistance{/g}, a +2 bonus to all {g|Encyclopedia:Concentration}concentration checks{/g}, and rises the {g|Encyclopedia:DC}DC{/g} of the {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saving throws{/g} against all their spells and abilities by 2.
141b1573-db2a-4a5f-9406-3be9f73a2b3b: This {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} removes all negative levels from the target, while also granting them {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Immunity}immunity to energy{/g} drain and mind-affecting effects for 1 min per Azata's {g|Encyclopedia:Caster_Level}caster level{/g}.
9533e3e7-7a28-40c0-abb3-195c4fe47a4b: This {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} removes fatigue and exhausted effects from all party members.
c04e778a-3119-4b16-a42e-e2542416b264: Transform thirty ordinary items and give them to the recipient
a5123752-7144-4983-ba59-2bec913704d1: Under the effect of this {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g}, all companions become immune to mind-affecting, charm, fear, compulsion, emotion, shaken, confusion effects. They also get a +3 luck {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on all {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saving throws{/g} and {g|Encyclopedia:Damage_Reduction}DR{/g} 5/- while they are in a 10-foot range from Azata.
54fedb4c-47e5-4b72-a354-3bbd91fcbdd1: Under this {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} Azata and all her allies in 30 feet from her get a {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to all {g|Encyclopedia:Skills}skills{/g} and to a {g|Encyclopedia:Critical}critical{/g} confirmation {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}roll{/g} equal to +1 per 3 {g|Encyclopedia:Caster_Level}caster levels{/g}, as well as a bonus to {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saving throws{/g} equal to +1 per 6 caster levels the Azata possesses.
780f66b3-14ff-426b-885f-40ef8ae84ef5: Visit the Court and talk to Aranka
e02f0bff-6357-4b21-bcbe-587a2bb6f0b1: Visit the Court and talk to the Maitresse
9d7feac3-a9f0-47c8-88c3-54518493d996: Wait two weeks and visit the Court
6ca21cbb-16bd-4b49-a98e-192e0c7ab91c: When ready to begin the search, the Commander should notify Early Sunset.
62cae637-6631-4609-af4f-d2f9dd7d8649: Whenever Azata casts a {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} that targets individual creatures, not areas, the spell affects one additional creature within a 30-foot range from the target. If the target is an enemy, the spell affects one additional enemy; if the target is an ally, the spell affects one additional ally. Additionally, spells that target enemies {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} them for {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}2d6{/g} + mythic rank.
3dffdfbf-a08b-45eb-8836-d7c58723df6f: Whenever an opponent with fewer hit dice than the dragon comes within a 30-foot range of the dragon, they must make a Will saving throw. If it fails, the opponent becomes shaken (or, if they have less than 5 hit dice, panicked) for 5d6 rounds. A successful saving throw makes the creature immune to this dragon's Frightful Presence for 24 hours. This is a mind-affecting fear effect.
0fb74e32-bc4d-40b9-8602-47aa534a9ae3: With this {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g}, Azata chooses to create one of 5 possible 10-feet rainbow domes. While within it, party members get immunity either to fire, to cold, to acid, to electricity or sonic {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} by her choice.
c54c74a7-0456-409c-ada6-ebe2a43b0c0a: You may call down a rainbow star that deals {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d6{/g} per 3 {g|Encyclopedia:Caster_Level}caster levels{/g} points of acid, cold, electricity, fire, or sonic {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g}, depending on the greatest potential damage (taking into consideration the target's immunities and {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Resistance}energy resistances{/g}). The star falls down in a vertical stroke at whatever target point you choose within long range.
bf0eb1a7-abb8-4021-a33d-90240d6c9280: Your dragon companion claims that your good friends are waiting for you on a ridge not far from Drezen. Who are they and what do they want from you?
